notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Application Runtimes.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which
gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from
the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Openshift Application Runtimes provides an application platform
that reduces the complexity of developing and operating applications
(monoliths and microservices) for OpenShift as a containerized platform.

The RHOAR Eclipse Vert.x 3.5.3 release serves as a replacement for RHOAR Eclipse Vert.x 3.5.1, and includes bug fixes and enhancements. For a detailed list of issues resolved in the community Eclipse Vert.x 3.5.3 release, see the release notes in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* vertx: Improper neutralization of CRLF sequences allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP response headers (CVE-2018-12537)

* vertx-web: Incomplete CSRF validation by CSRFHandler (CVE-2018-12540)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')

notes.text: In Eclipse Vert.x version 3.0 to 3.5.1, the HttpServer response headers and HttpClient request headers do not filter carriage return and line feed characters from the header value. This allow unfiltered values to inject a new header in the client request or server response.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2018-12537 vertx: Improper neutralization of CRLF sequences allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP response headers
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: While the affected artifact is being shipped in Fuse 6.3 via camel-vertx component, the vulnerable code is not being used, therefore Fuse 6.3 is not affected.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2018-12537 vertx: Improper neutralization of CRLF sequences allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP response headers

notes.text: In version from 3.0.0 to 3.5.2 of Eclipse Vert.x, the CSRFHandler do not assert that the XSRF Cookie matches the returned XSRF header/form parameter. This allows replay attacks with previously issued tokens which are not expired yet.
